Package de.oth.programs.tests

Class MultiplayerFirstTestProgram

java.lang.Object
de.oth.programs.tests.MultiplayerFirstTestProgram
All Implemented Interfaces:
BlockLibProgram
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiplayerFirstTestClientAIProgram, MultiplayerFirstTestClientProgram
public abstract class MultiplayerFirstTestProgram
extends java.lang.Object
implements BlockLibProgram
This program was written as a very plain-and-simple PoC of a network library called KryoNet.
How To: Start two instances of this program simultaneously.
In the first of the 2 instances press "L" to configure it as a Server.
Deprecated:In the second of the 2 instances press "O" to configure it as a Client, that automatically tries to connect to the server on localhost.
Instead, use the provided GUI in the pause menu to connect the client instance to the server.
You can use "K" to send a test message to the server
Since:
2020
Author:
Philipp Dormeier (HSP-SoSe 2020 Network)

    • doTick

    • onGameStart

      public void onGameStart()
      Description copied from interface: BlockLibProgram
      Gets called once, when the game starts. Can be used for initialization. Either "game.createFilledWorld()" or "game.createEmptyWorld()" has to be called here. CAREFUL! Since the world is not yet created, it can not be used to set Blocks into the world.
      Specified by:
      onGameStart in interface BlockLibProgram

    • onWorldLoaded

      public void onWorldLoaded()
      Description copied from interface: BlockLibProgram
      Gets called one time once the world is completely loaded. Can be used to set initial blocks into the world.
      Specified by:
      onWorldLoaded in interface BlockLibProgram

    • update

      public void update​(float deltaTime)
      Description copied from interface: BlockLibProgram
      Gets called once in every render loop. It may be that during the first calls, the world is not completely loaded. This can cause problems when calling e.g. the setBlock function of the WorldInteraction. Make sure to utilize the returned boolean value, by checking if the placement of the block was successful.
      Specified by:
      update in interface BlockLibProgram
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - the time that has passed since the last update call.
